recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A traditional Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and cook pancetta until crispy. Add minced garlic and sauté briefly.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and mix in grated Parmesan cheese.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Add pasta to the skillet and toss with pancetta.
Remove skillet from heat, stir in the egg mixture, and mix quickly to create a creamy sauce.
Adjust consistency with reserved pasta water as needed. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan cheese on top.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A quick and healthy dish packed with vibrant vegetables and a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
directions: Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, sauté until fragrant.
Add broccoli, carrot, and bell pepper, stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Add zucchini and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Mix in soy sauce and cornstarch slurry. Cook until sauce thickens.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Homemade Chicken Tacos
recipes.description: Delicious chicken tacos made with a zesty lime marinade and fresh toppings.
ingredients: Sour cream and salsa for serving
directions: Marinate chicken in lime juice, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder for 20 minutes.
Cook chicken in a skillet over medium heat until fully cooked.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
Assemble tacos by filling tortillas with chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, and cheese.
Top with sour cream and salsa as desired.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Soft and chewy cookies loaded with chocolate chips.
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cream butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
In another bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add to the butter mixture.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden. Cool on a wire rack.
